text: <a href="../2-Samuel-7-1/" title="2 Samuel 7:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 And it came to pass, when the king sat in his house, and the LORD had given him rest round about from all his enemies;

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-2/" title="2 Samuel 7:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 That the king said unto Nathan the prophet, See now, I dwell in an house of cedar, but the ark of God dwelleth within curtains.
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-3/" title="2 Samuel 7:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And Nathan said to the king, Go, do all that *is* in thine heart; for the LORD *is* with thee.
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-4/" title="2 Samuel 7:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And it came to pass that night, that the word of the LORD came unto Nathan, saying,
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-5/" title="2 Samuel 7:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Go and tell my servant David, Thus saith the LORD, Shalt thou build me an house for me to dwell in?

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-6/" title="2 Samuel 7:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Whereas I have not dwelt in *any* house since the time that I brought up the children of Israel out of Egypt, even to this day, but have walked in a tent and in a tabernacle.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-7/" title="2 Samuel 7:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 In all *the places* wherein I have walked with all the children of Israel spake I a word with any of the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people Israel, saying, Why build ye not me an house of cedar?

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-8/" title="2 Samuel 7:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 Now therefore so shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people, over Israel:

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-9/" title="2 Samuel 7:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And I was with thee whithersoever thou wentest, and have cut off all thine enemies out of thy sight, and have made thee a great name, like unto the name of the great *men* that *are* in the earth.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-10/" title="2 Samuel 7:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Moreover I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more, as beforetime,

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-11/" title="2 Samuel 7:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And as since the time that I commanded judges *to be* over my people Israel, and have caused thee to rest from all thine enemies. Also the LORD telleth thee that he will make thee an house.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-12/" title="2 Samuel 7:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And when thy days be fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy bowels, and I will establish his kingdom.
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-13/" title="2 Samuel 7:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 He shall build an house for my name, and I will stablish the throne of his kingdom for ever.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-14/" title="2 Samuel 7:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he commit iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men:

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-15/" title="2 Samuel 7:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 But my mercy shall not depart away from him, as I took *it* from Saul, whom I put away before thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-16/" title="2 Samuel 7:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And thine house and thy kingdom shall be established for ever before thee: thy throne shall be established for ever.
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-17/" title="2 Samuel 7:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-18/" title="2 Samuel 7:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Then went king David in, and sat before the LORD, and he said, Who *am* I, O Lord GOD? and what *is* my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-19/" title="2 Samuel 7:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 And this was yet a small thing in thy sight, O Lord GOD; but thou hast spoken also of thy servant's house for a great while to come. And *is* this the manner of man, O Lord GOD?
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-20/" title="2 Samuel 7:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 And what can David say more unto thee? for thou, Lord GOD, knowest thy servant.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-21/" title="2 Samuel 7:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 For thy word's sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou done all these great things, to make thy servant know *them*.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-22/" title="2 Samuel 7:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 Wherefore thou art great, O LORD God: for *there is* none like thee, neither *is there any* God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-23/" title="2 Samuel 7:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 And what one nation in the earth *is* like thy people, *even* like Israel, whom God went to redeem for a people to himself, and to make him a name, and to do for you great things and terrible, for thy land, before thy people, which thou redeemedst to thee from Egypt, *from* the nations and their gods?

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-24/" title="2 Samuel 7:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 For thou hast confirmed to thyself thy people Israel *to be* a people unto thee for ever: and thou, LORD, art become their God.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-25/" title="2 Samuel 7:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 And now, O LORD God, the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, and concerning his house, establish *it* for ever, and do as thou hast said.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-26/" title="2 Samuel 7:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 And let thy name be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts *is* the God over Israel: and let the house of thy servant David be established before thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-27/" title="2 Samuel 7:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 For thou, O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, hast revealed to thy servant, saying, I will build thee an house: therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray this prayer unto thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-28/" title="2 Samuel 7:28 KJV verse detail"><span id="30" class="versehover">28 And now, O Lord GOD, thou *art* that God, and thy words be true, and thou hast promised this goodness unto thy servant:

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-29/" title="2 Samuel 7:29 KJV verse detail"><span id="31" class="versehover">29 Therefore now let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue for ever before thee: for thou, O Lord GOD, hast spoken *it*: and with thy blessing let the house of thy servant be blessed for ever.
